questions.questionText: Which method is the entry point of a Java program?
questions.funFact: The main method signature must be exactly 'public static void main(String[] args)'.

questions.questionText: Java supports multiple inheritance through classes?
questions.funFact: Java uses interfaces to allow multiple inheritance-like behavior.

questions.questionText: Which package contains the ArrayList class?
questions.funFact: ArrayList is part of Javaâ€™s Collections Framework and resizes dynamically.

questions.questionText: Which keyword is used to handle exceptions in Java?
questions.funFact: Try, catch, and finally blocks allow precise control over exception handling.

questions.questionText: Interfaces can have method implementations in Java 8+?
questions.funFact: Default methods in interfaces allow adding functionality without breaking existing implementations.

questions.questionText: Which loop is guaranteed to execute at least once?
questions.funFact: Do-while loops check the condition after executing the loop body.

questions.questionText: Which keyword declares an exception in a method signature?
questions.funFact: 'throws' lists the exceptions a method can propagate to its caller.

questions.questionText: Which method is used to compare two strings in Java?
questions.funFact: Using '==' compares references, not content; 'equals()' compares actual string content.

questions.questionText: Which access modifier allows access within the same package?
questions.funFact: Package-private (default) access means no modifier is used in the declaration.

questions.questionText: Which keyword creates an object in Java?
questions.funFact: The 'new' keyword allocates memory for an object and calls its constructor.
